input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Tanning salon treatment has a direct effect on foot size. Going to the beach has a direct effect on foot size. The overall probability of tanning salon treatment is 5%. The probability of no tanning salon treatment and large feet is 13%. The probability of tanning salon treatment and large feet is 3%. Is the chance of large feet smaller when observing tanning salon treatment?
